meanings.definition: In a manner that is out of chronological order or time
meanings.sent1: She placed the ancient artifact anachronously on the modern table.
meanings.sent2: The knight's armor looked anachronously out of place in the futuristic setting.
meanings.sent3: The time-traveler accidentally wore anachronously mismatched socks.
meanings.sent4: Her retro hairstyle seemed anachronously stylish in the contemporary crowd.
meanings.sent5: The old-fashioned carriage moved anachronously through the bustling city streets.

meanings.definition: In a way that is not in accordance with the time period in which something exists or occurs
meanings.sent1: The play featured characters speaking anachronously with modern slang.
meanings.sent2: The film depicted dinosaurs living anachronously alongside humans.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared anachronously traditional dishes using modern techniques.
meanings.sent4: The antique clock ticked anachronously in the digital age.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted anachronously accurate portraits of historical figures.
